feature_selection.rationale: EDA and experiments confirmed all four measurement features are predictive, with petal measurements showing superior discriminative power. ID column provides no predictive value.

scaling.rationale: Features are on similar scales (all in centimeters) but standardization improves performance for distance-based and regularized algorithms. Experiments showed minimal impact on tree-based models but significant improvement for logistic regression.

missing_values.rationale: Dataset contains no missing values as confirmed during EDA.

create_ratio_features.rationale: Initial experiments showed ratio features (petal length/width, sepal length/width) achieved perfect cross-validation scores, suggesting potential overfitting. Baseline experiment should use original features only to establish robust performance baseline.

interaction_features.rationale: Polynomial interaction features achieved perfect scores in experiments but may lead to overfitting on this small dataset. Reserved for future iterations if baseline underperforms.

dimensionality_reduction.rationale: With only 4 features and excellent class separability demonstrated in EDA, dimensionality reduction is unnecessary and may lose interpretability.

primary_algorithm.name: LogisticRegression
primary_algorithm.rationale: Logistic Regression with C=1.0 achieved 0.9967 macro AUC on test set, outperforming other configurations. Provides interpretable coefficients and handles multi-class naturally.

secondary_algorithm.name: RandomForestClassifier
secondary_algorithm.rationale: Random Forest achieved 0.9867 macro AUC and provides feature importance insights. Serves as robust tree-based baseline for comparison.

cross_validation.rationale: Stratified CV maintains class balance across folds. 5-fold provides good bias-variance tradeoff for 120 training samples.

feature_importance.rationale: Critical for understanding which measurements most discriminate between species, validating biological domain knowledge.

coefficient_analysis.rationale: Standardized coefficients allow direct comparison of feature contributions in logistic regression.

confusion_matrix_analysis.rationale: Identify which species pairs are most difficult to distinguish, particularly Iris-versicolor vs Iris-virginica based on EDA insights.

misclassification_inspection.rationale: Examine feature values of misclassified samples to understand model limitations and potential areas for improvement.

calibration_analysis.rationale: Assess probability calibration quality since macro AUC depends on well-calibrated probability estimates.

class_specific_metrics.rationale: Given perfect class balance, identify if any species is systematically harder to classify.

learning_curves.rationale: With small dataset (120 samples), assess if models would benefit from more data or are overfitting.

success_criteria.interpretability: Feature importance aligns with domain knowledge (petal measurements > sepal measurements)
